reviews.text:
This monument stands in tribute to Mary Santpere, a Spanish actress, singer. Probably not much known outside of Spain, so I can say what her legacy was. The monument is a bronze fountain that looks like the theater of Epidaurus. Around the sculpture are a series of friezes depicting  scenes of the her life.

It looks okay. Probably on worthwhile visiting if you’re on La Ramba.

Monumento a Mary Santpere is an odd but strangly cool monument along the famous  Las Ramblas boulevard that we passed as we were wandering along arguably the most famous street in this vibrant city.
The monument is in honour of the famous Spanish actress .
It has some interesting inscriptions upon the face of the monument and it looks superb and makes for some great photographic opportunities. 
It's easy to locate on Las Ramblas and is most definitely well worth checking out.
A strange monument placed on La Rambla street.In fact,I didn't know it's a monument,I thought it's an unusual bench...

This monument, located on the Rambla, is made in honour of Mary Santpere.
Mary Santpere Hernandez was a spanish actress.
Born in Barcelona 1. september 1913.
Died in Madrid 23. september 1992.
It is not a big attraction, but worth to know, when you pass it.
